title: Think that your plastic is being recycled? Think again. - MIT Technology Review

title: Philadelphia Union and Subaru Reveal Sculpture to celebrate recycling milestone - Philadelphia Union
summary: Subaru and the Philadelphia Union have created a 'zero landfill' sculpture at Subaru Park, marking it as the first zero landfill stadium in Major League Soccer. They have diverted over one million pounds of waste from landfills and provided knowledge to help other companies achieve zero waste status.
green_innovation: TRUE. This initiative of creating a zero landfill stadium and helping other businesses achieve a similar status aligns with the principles of green innovation in waste reduction and environmental sustainability.
business_innovation: FALSE. The article focuses on waste reduction and environmental efforts rather than introducing a new product or business process.
green_product: FALSE. The article discusses waste diversion efforts and sharing knowledge rather than a specific product designed to significantly reduce environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: TRUE. The article highlights the implementation of zero landfill practices and knowledge-sharing for waste reduction, demonstrating a green process that minimizes environmental impact.
company: Subaru of America, Inc. and the Philadelphia Union

greenwashing: FALSE. The article focuses on real sustainability achievements such as waste reduction and recycling efforts, rather than misleading environmental claims that would constitute greenwashing.

title: Circularity comes to wiring accessories in new Nordic launch | ABB - ABB
summary: ABB has launched the SAGA™ wiring collection of light switches and sockets made from bio-circular and recyclable materials in the Nordic region. The products are designed for sustainability, integrate with ABB's automation systems, and are manufactured in net-zero operations, emphasizing environmental friendliness.
green_innovation: TRUE. This is a green innovation as the SAGA™ wiring collection uses bio-circular and recyclable materials, manufactured in net-zero operations, contributing to environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE. The introduction of the SAGA™ wiring collection represents a new product innovation for ABB in the form of sustainable light switches and sockets designed for sustainability.
green_product: TRUE. The SAGA™ wiring collection qualifies as a green product due to its use of bio-circular and recyclable materials, sustainable manufacturing processes, and functional design that supports low environmental impact.
green_process: TRUE. The manufacturing process of the SAGA™ wiring collection, with its emphasis on using bio-circular and recyclable materials, energy efficiency, and waste reduction, aligns with the definition of a green process.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 335931 - Current-Carrying Wiring Device Manufacturing, 335999 - All Other Miscellaneous Electrical Equipment and Component Manufacturing, 335110 - Electric Lamp Bulb and Part Manufacturing, 335122 - Commercial, Industrial, and Institutional Electric Lighting Fixture Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE. The article does not exhibit greenwashing as it accurately describes the environmentally friendly attributes of ABB's SAGA™ wiring collection without deceptive or misleading claims.
